description:
A common set of considerations when planning to release a new
application are around hosting and resources:

1. Which platforms will support my app?
2. What OS should I use?
3. What WSGI server should I use?
4. How much memory and CPU do I need?

Zappa, a framework for running serverless WSGI applications on top of
AWS Lambda, can help address these and other questions around
application deployment. With some configuration (as code), Zappa can get
you up and running quickly, letting you focus on developing the
application instead of the infrastructure.

In this talk we’ll go through some of these kinds of questions to see
how they might be answered in traditional solutions and then see how
Zappa handles them. We’ll also talk about a few specific configuration
options for handling SSL certificates and running Django commands on the
Zappa-deployed application.
title: Serverless Django with Zappa
